title: ProductImporterPro
description: A production-ready CSV product import platform with a React + TypeScript UI, FastAPI backend, and an async processing pipeline using Celery + RabbitMQ. Uses Redis for temporary CSV storage and real-time progress tracking, with PostgreSQL (Aiven) as the persistent database.
longDescription: ProductImporterPro is a full-stack system for importing large product catalogs from CSV files without blocking API requests. The React + TypeScript frontend uploads CSVs and subscribes to live progress updates via Server-Sent Events (SSE). The FastAPI backend creates an UploadTask record in PostgreSQL, stores the raw CSV bytes temporarily in Redis with a TTL, and enqueues a Celery task into RabbitMQ. Celery workers consume tasks from RabbitMQ, retrieve the CSV from Redis, parse and validate rows, deduplicate by SKU, and perform high-throughput bulk upserts into PostgreSQL using ON CONFLICT DO UPDATE. Throughout processing, the worker writes progress snapshots back to Redis, which FastAPI streams to the UI. Webhook configurations are stored in PostgreSQL and triggered asynchronously after successful imports.
features: Bulk CSV upload and background processing using Celery workers (no request timeouts)
RabbitMQ-backed task queue with reliable producer/consumer flow
Redis-based temporary CSV storage (TTL) and real-time progress cache for SSE streaming
High-performance bulk upsert into PostgreSQL with SKU-based conflict handling
Stage-based progress tracking (retrieving → parsing → validating → importing → finalizing → complete)
Upload history with totals: processed, failed, duplicates, timestamps, and error messages
Webhook management and asynchronous webhook triggers after import completion
Dockerized local development with Compose (FastAPI, worker, Redis, RabbitMQ, Postgres, Flower)
Railway-ready multi-service deployment (frontend, backend, workers, broker, cache) with Aiven Postgres

title: AskMyPDF
description: An AI-powered PDF assistant that turns static documents into interactive Q&A experiences using vector search and Gemini AI.
longDescription: AskMyPDF is a full-stack web app that converts PDFs into searchable knowledge bases with chat-style question answering. It uses server-side Next.js routes for secure upload and processing, chunks PDF content into embeddings, stores them in MongoDB Atlas Vector Search, and serves natural language answers via Google Gemini models. This project strengthened my skills in vector databases, embeddings pipelines, AI integration, and building clean, responsive UIs with real-time chat interactions.
features: AI-powered question answering over uploaded PDFs
Smart text extraction, chunking, and vector storage
WhatsApp-style real-time chat interface
Secure token-based API access for backend routes
Scalable architecture using Next.js 14 server components and API routes

title: WhatsApp Web Clone
description: A minimal WhatsApp Web-style chat app featuring real-time messaging, powered by FastAPI and React, designed for hands-on learning of full-stack best practices.
longDescription: WhatsApp Web Clone brings together real-time chat features and a clean WhatsApp-style user interface, using FastAPI backend and React frontend. The project includes live Socket.IO messaging, RESTful APIs, MongoDB integration, and a fully Dockerized setup. Designed as a robust template for learning scalable web architecture and production-oriented development.
features: Live real-time chat using Socket.IO
RESTful backend with FastAPI and Python
MongoDB data storage with Motor
Responsive WhatsApp-inspired UI
Dockerized infrastructure for easy deployment
Mobile-friendly, modern design

title: ChatVerse
description: A real-time messaging web app built with Django, WebSockets, and Redis for seamless communication.
longDescription: ChatVerse delivers instant messaging using WebSockets and Redis channels, with PostgreSQL for message persistence. Features include typing indicators, read receipts, and group chat support.
features: Real-time message delivery
Typing indicators and read receipts
Group chat support
Message history with PostgreSQL persistence

title: GadgetGuard API
description: A secure Node.js & Express REST API for managing high-tech gadgets, powered by PostgreSQL with JWT authentication.
longDescription: GadgetGuard API provides a production-ready backend for gadget management with automated CI/CD using GitHub Actions, Docker, and Render deployment.
features: JWT-based authentication
RESTful API design
Automated CI/CD pipeline
Docker containerization
